Sentencas: Thermal cycle and exposure tests were conducted on ceramic-to-metal joints prepared by a new sealing technique.
Titulo: Effects of thermal cycling and thermal aging on the hermeticity and strength of silver-copper oxide air-brazed seals

Sentencas: Known as reactive air brazing, this joining method is currently being considered for use in sealing various high-temperature solid-state electrochemical devices, including planar solid oxide fuel cells (pSOFC).
Titulo: Effects of thermal cycling and thermal aging on the hermeticity and strength of silver-copper oxide air-brazed seals

Sentencas: In order to simulate a typical pSOFC application, test specimens were prepared by joining ceramic anode/electrolyte bilayers to metal washers, of the same composition as the common frame materials employed in pSOFC stacks, using a filler metal composed of 4 mol% CuO in silver.
Titulo: Effects of thermal cycling and thermal aging on the hermeticity and strength of silver-copper oxide air-brazed seals

Sentencas: The brazed samples were exposure tested at 750 degrees C for 200, 400, and 800h in both simulated fuel and air environments and thermally cycled at rapid rate (75 degrees C Min(-1)) between room temperature and 750 degrees C for as many as 50 cycles.
Titulo: Effects of thermal cycling and thermal aging on the hermeticity and strength of silver-copper oxide air-brazed seals

Sentencas: Subsequent joint strength testing and microstructural analysis indicated that the samples exposure tested in air displayed little degradation with respect to strength, hermeticity, or microstructure out to 800 h of exposure.
Titulo: Effects of thermal cycling and thermal aging on the hermeticity and strength of silver-copper oxide air-brazed seals

Sentencas: Those tested in fuel showed no change in rupture strength or loss in hermeticity after 800h of high-temperature exposure, but did undergo microstructural change due to the dissolution of hydrogen into the silver-based braze material.
Titulo: Effects of thermal cycling and thermal aging on the hermeticity and strength of silver-copper oxide air-brazed seals

Sentencas: Air-brazed specimens subjected to rapid thermal cycling exhibited no loss in joint strength or hermeticity, but displayed initial signs of seal delamination along the braze-electrolyte interface after 50 cycles.
Titulo: Effects of thermal cycling and thermal aging on the hermeticity and strength of silver-copper oxide air-brazed seals
Effects of thermal cycling and thermal aging on the hermeticity and strength of silver-copper oxide air-brazed seals
